restaurant_name.name: Black Dog Smoke & Ale House
restaurant_name.summary: Black Dog Smoke & Ale House is a popular BBQ spot located near the University of Illinois campus in downtown Urbana, IL. Housed in a restored train depot, it offers delicious ribs, brisket, and burgers paired with craft beers. The restaurant also boasts a brick four-season porch for outdoor dining with open air from large windows and radiant heating units to keep guests warm on chilly nights.
restaurant_name.contact: 320 N Chestnut St, Champaign, IL 61820, USA•http://www.blackdogchampaign.com/•(217) 954-0465•Tips and more reviews for Black Dog Smoke & Ale House

restaurant_name.name: Sakanaya
restaurant_name.summary: Sakanaya, located on Green Street in Champaign, offers a stylish space where you can enjoy inventive sushi, ramen, Japanese entrees, and sake. The restaurant has gained popularity for its attention to detail in both the menu and decor. The owner's travels through Asia have influenced the restaurant's ambiance, while the chef's experience in New York City restaurants ensures high-quality cuisine.
restaurant_name.contact: 403 E Green St, Champaign, IL 61820, USA•http://www.sakanayarestaurant.com/•(217) 344-1400•Tips and more reviews for Sakanaya

restaurant_name.name: Ko Fusion
restaurant_name.summary: KoFusion is a trendy eatery that offers a diverse menu of contemporary American dishes and traditional sushi options. Situated in downtown Champaign, this stylish restaurant boasts a modern ambiance and a spacious outdoor patio adorned with chic decor. Patrons can relish in the stunning cityscape while savoring the delectable Chicago Roll, which comes highly recommended. The patio is equipped with numerous tall heaters strategically placed around the tables, ensuring that every customer can enjoy their meal comfortably.

restaurant_name.name: Seven Saints
restaurant_name.summary: Seven Saints is a stylish American tavern with wood-trimmed interiors, offering creative burgers, craft beer, cocktails, and wine. The restaurant has the ambiance of an old British pub but with a unique American twist. It's known for its extensive selection of American beers, including seasonal choices. While sliders are their signature dish, they also offer a variety of other delicious items like pretzel bites, cheese curds, sandwiches, salads, soups and desserts from a local bakery.
restaurant_name.contact: 32 E Chester St, Champaign, IL 61820, USA•http://www.sevensaintsbar.com/•(217) 351-7775•Tips and more reviews for Seven Saints

restaurant_name.name: Farren's Pub & Eatery
restaurant_name.summary: Farren's Pub & Eatery is a laid-back establishment that offers a variety of American comfort food, including burgers and a selection of draft beers. Located in downtown Champaign, this popular spot opened its doors in 2019 and has quickly become a favorite among locals and visitors alike. Customers rave about the delicious burgers, with options like the spicy burger with ghost pepper cheese and one topped with mushrooms receiving high praise. The menu also features other tasty options such as chicken strips and cheese curds.
restaurant_name.contact: 117 N Walnut St, Champaign, IL 61820, USA•http://www.farrenspub.com/•(217) 359-6977•Tips and more reviews for Farren's Pub & Eatery

restaurant_name.name: Papa Del's Pizza Factory
restaurant_name.summary: Papa Del's Pizza Factory is a popular spot in Champaign known for its heaping deep-dish pizzas, pasta, and craft brews. The Sicilian pan pizza is their specialty and a must-try when visiting this stylish and spacious outpost. For those not into deep dish, they also offer thin crust and gluten-free options with vegan cheese. The restaurant has been a favorite among Illini since 1970 and is great for group gatherings due to its filling signature deep dish pizzas.

restaurant_name.name: Maize Mexican Grill
restaurant_name.summary: Maize Mexican Grill is a no-frills eatery in the vibrant campus town of University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. Since its opening in 2011, it has been recreating authentic Mexican flavors from Michoacan and Guerrero. The restaurant prides itself on using fresh ingredients and making handmade corn tortillas. It's a popular spot for locals and visitors alike, with Guy Fieri even paying a visit.

restaurant_name.name: The Original Pancake House

While the omelette was generously filled and satisfying, the chocolate chip pancakes were described as slightly dry but easily remedied with syrup.

restaurant_name.summary: Pizzeria Antica is a trendy establishment known for its wood-fired Neapolitan pizzas adorned with unique toppings and accompanied by a selection of wines. The overall quality of their pizza is commendable, boasting great flavor, quality cheese, and tasty sauce. However, some customers have noted that the tomato sauce could be slightly watery and the crust lacked a bit of crunch. Despite these minor drawbacks, the pizza remains enjoyable and should not be deemed bad in any way.

restaurant_name.name: The Courier Cafe

It's known for its delightful breakfast options and charming antique setting. The cafe serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner daily, making it a great choice for any mealtime. With an array of food options including salads, burgers, chicken dishes, and an extensive selection of milkshake flavors to choose from.

restaurant_name.name: The Ribeye
restaurant_name.summary: The Ribeye is a classic steakhouse in Champaign-Urbana known for its comfortable ambiance and delicious meat and fish dishes. One of their signature offerings is the steak dinner for two, featuring 16 ounces of hand-cut ribeye to share, along with unlimited trips to the salad bar, fresh baked bread, and a choice of side for each person. The restaurant has a welcoming and family-friendly atmosphere, making it suitable for both intimate dinners and gatherings with friends or loved ones.

Known for its succulent steaks, fresh seafood choices, and refreshing cocktails, it provides an exquisite dining experience. Customers have praised the attentive service and perfectly cooked steaks while enjoying the relaxed yet sophisticated atmosphere. restaurant_name.name: El Toro Bravo

restaurant_name.name: Cafe Kopi

restaurant_name.name: Baldarotta's Porketta & Sicilian Sausage
restaurant_name.summary: If there's one suggestion I have for dining in Champaign-Urbana, it's to prioritize visiting Baldarotta's Porketta & Sicilian Sandwiches. Situated inside the Lincoln Square Mall, this Sicilian eatery may appear unassuming at first glance, but don't let that deter you. This place is highly regarded and beloved by many due to its delectable food and consistently friendly staff.
restaurant_name.contact: 300 S Broadway Ave, Urbana, IL 61801, USA•http://www.baldarottas.com/•(217) 800-5726•Tips and more reviews for Baldarotta's Porketta & Sicilian Sausage

restaurant_name.name: Suzu's Bakery
restaurant_name.summary: Suzu's Bakery offers excellent customer service, with helpful front staff who are willing to explain anything. A unique aspect of this bakery is the ability to see into the kitchen and watch the baking process. Despite this, their prices remain affordable, surprising customers who expected higher costs due to in-house baking. The hot tea selection is a must-try, particularly the Ginger Peach and Pineapple Lychee flavors which are truly fantastic.

restaurant_name.name: Mid Summer Lounge
restaurant_name.summary: Mid Summer Lounge is a Chinese restaurant located in Champaign's campustown area, offering a relaxed dining atmosphere. They serve a wide range of Chinese dishes, from noodle soups to dumplings and wontons. The menu includes various flavors of ramen and dumplings, which are particularly popular among customers. Their Schachman-style beef noodles are highly recommended by patrons who appreciate the flavorful broth.
